content.text:
# New Features

The Eliza project has introduced several significant new features:

- **Onchain Agent Transformer**: Transform Eliza agents into Solidity smart contracts deployable on 10+ blockchains (PR #2319)
- **Character Loading Improvements**: Support for loading characters from URLs (PR #2281) and enabling multiple remote character URLs (PR #2328)
- **Memory Management**: Added getMemoryByIds to database adapters (PR #2293)
- **Echo Chambers**: Added dead room detection and conversation starter functionality (PR #2248)
- **DexScreener Integration**: Added token price action functionality (PR #1865) and trending features (PR #2325)
- **Image Generation**: Added safe_mode and cfg_scale for Venice image generation (PR #2354) and Groq image vision provider (PR #2342)
- **RAG Knowledge**: Enhanced RAG knowledge handling capabilities (PR #2351)
- **New Clients/Providers**: Added Instagram client (PR #1964) and Atoma provider (PR #2082)
- **S3 Flexibility**: Improved S3 integration options (PR #2379)

# Bug Fixes

Several important bug fixes have been implemented:

- **Environment Variables**: Fixed OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable in config (PR #2324)
- **Memory Issues**: Fixed Farcaster memory issues (PR #2307)
- **Configuration Improvements**: 
  - Fixed alignment of base URL in client when API runs on different port (PR #2353)
  - Prevented app crashes when REMOTE_CHARACTER_URLS is undefined (PR #2384, #2382)
  - Set default Squid Router plugin throttle to 1000 (PR #2386)
- **Import Fixes**: Corrected typo in import statement for Solana AgentKit plugin (PR #2370)
- **Docker Issues**: Fixed docker images, compose, and documentation (PR #2347)
- **Package Updates**: Updated package.json of core package (PR #2301)
- **Reply Hallucinations**: Ensured RA Action reply does not hallucinate (PR #2355)

# Testing and Code Quality

Significant improvements to testing and code quality have been made:

- **New Tests**: Added tests for GitHub client (PR #2407), Slack client (PR #2404), and Solana plugin (PR #2345)
- **Code Organization**: Moved existing tests to new __tests__ directory (PR #2404)
- **Refactoring**: 
  - Refactored websearch into a service (PR #2195)
  - Refactored Farcaster client environment configuration (PR #2087)
- **Linting**: Fixed lint errors (PR #2400, #2368)
- **Type Safety**: Implemented strict types to avoid errors (PR #2220)

# Documentation

Documentation has been enhanced across the project:

- **README Updates**: Updated main README.md (PR #2309, #2280) and fixed formatting in Browser section (PR #2336)
- **Translations**: Updated README_FR.md (PR #2356) and README_TR.md (PR #2334)
- **Organization**: Reorganized README translations into a dedicated i18n directory structure (PR #2149)
- **Client Documentation**: Fixed GitHub client README.md (PR #2346)
- **Descriptions**: Improved descriptions throughout the project (PR #2394)

# Maintenance

Various maintenance tasks have been completed:

- **Release Preparation**: Prepared for version 0.1.9-alpha.1 (PR #2359)
- **Cleanup**: Improved exit code handling after positive cleanup (PR #2398)
- **Error Handling**: Addressed startup errors from environment misconfiguration (PR #2378)
- **Follow-up Work**: Completed sequel to PR #2275 (PR #2350)

categories.title: DankVR and ShawMakesMagic on AI, Crypto, and Open Source

content.text: DankVR expressed excitement about a new $3,000 device releasing in May that can run 405b AI models locally when two are chained together, showing enthusiasm for local-first open source AI.

DankVR shared a comprehensive analysis of crypto plugins in ElizaOS, identifying 23 distinct blockchain/crypto-focused plugins supporting various ecosystems including EVM-compatible chains. They used code2prompt to analyze the capabilities.

DankVR showcased a new preview of the Eliza contributor leaderboard with features like skill cards navigation, daily summaries, and URL-based filtering, describing it as making 'open source more like an MMORPG'.
DankVR expressed desire for an 'AI intern' to scribe relevant information from group chats to help coordinate decisions and avoid the 'game of telephone' effect when people forget to take notes.

ShawMakesMagic highlighted a new v2 core for building lightweight, production-ready agents, crediting @bmgalego as a 'seriously cracked dev' and noting it should feel familiar to beginners while offering advanced capabilities.

ShawMakesMagic shared perspectives on AI development, suggesting that AGI won't come from one company or be one thing, comparing it to how 'humanity is not a brain.' They also discussed the concept of 'progressive automation' similar to 'progressive decentralization.'

ShawMakesMagic questioned the notion of autonomous agents, suggesting that many so-called autonomous systems are actually event-driven, with LLMs primarily helping to process unstructured data into structured output.
Both users showed interest in the intersection of AI, blockchain, and open source technologies, with a focus on practical applications and development frameworks.

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository has several open issues related to various bugs and feature requests. These issues span different aspects of the system including:

1. User Interface Issues:
   - Issue #2316: Users experiencing duplicate responses to actions
   - Issue #2395: Difficulty executing multiple dependent actions in response to a single user message

2. Deployment and Environment Problems:
   - Issue #2343: Bug when running in cloud from docker image
   - Issue #2360: Startup failures on macOS
   - Issue #2372: Twitter authentication failing on AWS EC2 instances with Error 399

3. Performance Concerns:
   - Issue #2311: Low performance under parallel requests

4. Plugin-specific Issues:
   - Issue #2320: Enhancement needed for query text extraction in the chainbase plugin
   - Issue #2373: Bugs related to image description service in the node plugin

5. Schema and Configuration Problems:
   - Issue #2339: Error with invalid schema
   - Issue #2381: Bug in dev.sh script when loading characters with the --character parameter

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on new features, enhancements, and version updates:

- PR #2326 introduces a draft example feature for strace with pnpm integration
- PR #2283 adds NFT functionality with ntf-starter and nft-generator components
- PR #2314 contributes changes labeled as 'Ng/phill' by user 0xnogo
- PR #2380 implements a plugin for the OriginTrail Decentralized Knowledge Graph
- PR #2331 enhances RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) knowledge handling and performance
- PR #2107 adds a Code In Plugin that loads characters from blockchain with PDA (Program Derived Address)

Version management PRs include #2361 (merging dev to main for version 0.1.9) and #2359 (preparation for version 0.1.9-alpha.1).

These contributions demonstrate active development across various aspects of the eliza project, including blockchain integration, knowledge management, and developer tooling.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From January 15-16, 2025, there were 30 new pull requests with 11 merged, 9 new issues, and 75 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (January 16-17, 2025) with 46 new pull requests (33 merged), 10 new issues, and 83 active contributors. This represents a 53% increase in new PRs, a 200% increase in merged PRs, and a 10.7% increase in active contributors day-over-day.
sources: From 2025-01-15 to 2025-01-16, elizaos/eliza had 30 new PRs (11 merged), 9 new issues, and 75 active contributors.
From 2025-01-16 to 2025-01-17, elizaos/eliza had 46 new PRs (33 merged), 10 new issues, and 83 active contributors.
